conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second, we will analyze the given x-t (position-time) graph.
The x-axis represents time (t) in seconds (s). The y-axis represents position (x) in meters (m).
The graph depicts a straight line.
The equation of a straight line in a position-time graph is given by: x(t) = v * t + x_0 where v is the velocity and x_0 is the initial position.
At t = 0, the line passes through x = 10 meters.

premise: At t = 0, the line passes through x = 10 meters.

conclusion: The line passes through the point (0, 10).
As time increases by 2 seconds from t = 0 to t = 2, the position changes from x = 10 to x = 20.

premise: The position changes from x = 10 to x = 20 as time increases by 2 seconds.
conclusion: The velocity v is v = (20 m - 10 m) / (2 s - 0 s) = 5 m/s.

premise: The graph depicts a straight line indicating constant velocity.
conclusion: The speed at any point in time is 5 m/s.

premise: The speed at any point in time is 5 m/s.
conclusion: The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 m/s.
